fortunes.text: vercel shows container metrics, not actual server
clawdbot config 'bind: "loopback"' is safe (923 exposed gateways on shodan had 'bind: "all"')
use SECURITY DEFINER helper functions to avoid infinite recursion in policies
optimistic locking ('.eq('status', 'pending')' on update) prevents double-approve bugs
pre-create record before send to get tracking ID for pixel injection
reflection > logging: activity logs don't build wisdom — need explicit lesson capture and analysis time
supply chain attacks: AI agents are the social engineering target now — clawdhub "Twitter" skill was malware (2026-02-07). all our skills are bundled core, clean.
integrating tools (task → discord) creates useful automation
funding rate arb between hyperliquid + dydx (both no-KYC) is most viable
when moving a route (/ → /dashboard), grep ALL references: middleware, proxy, auth callback, nav components, command palette. do it in one pass.
vercel github webhook can silently disconnect. check deploy dashboard if pushes stop deploying.
supabase realtime sends raw DB columns (snake_case), but if frontend uses camelCase transforms, realtime updates won't match
mobile didn't win by making desktop responsive, agents won't win by adding APIs to dashboards
explicit route matchers > regex exclusion patterns (more readable, fewer edge cases)
tool fragmentation is #1 pain, anivia's positioning validated
the AI agent is the social engineering target, not the human
fortunes.section: security alert — clawdhub supply chain attack (11:03 UTC)

fortunes.text: "conductor is an IDE with an agent. mundo should be an agent that shows structured data"
